resources.string:
✅ Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 ✅ Climate: Thrives in humid conditions with rainfall (100-120 cm).

 ✅ Soil: Grows well in laterite and sandy loam soil.

 ✅ Usage: Used for Ragi Porridge, dosa, and baby food.

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Palakkad and Wayanad.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June): Plowing, apply 8-10 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (June-July): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 8-10 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Aug): 40 kg N, 30 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Sept): 2 irrigations; Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Blast, smut – Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 110-130 days. Yield: 1.5-2.5 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi (Monsoon & Winter)

 ✅ Climate: Requires high rainfall (150-250 cm) and humid conditions.

 ✅ Soil: Grows best in clayey and laterite soil.

 ✅ Usage: Staple food in Kerala, used for rice dishes like Puttu and Idli.

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Grown in Kuttanad, known as the "Rice Bowl of Kerala."

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June & Oct-Nov): Field puddling, apply 10-15 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (June-July & Nov-Dec): Transplanting method (20 cm spacing). Seed rate: 30-40 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Jan): 60 kg N, 40 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before transplanting.

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Continuous flooding; Butachlor (1.5 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Bacterial blight, stem borer – Neem oil spray or Carbendazim (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Oct & March-April): 120-150 days. Yield: 2.5-4.5 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Needs 50-100 cm rainfall with temperatures around 20-30°C.

 ✅ Soil: Best in well-drained sandy loam soil.

 ✅ Usage: Used in food, fodder, and biofuel.

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Increasing maize production due to demand for fodder.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June & Oct-Nov): Apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (June-July & Oct-Nov): Drilling method (60 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 20-25 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 120 kg N, 60 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): 2-3 irrigations; Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Fall armyworm, rust – Neem oil or Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Oct & Feb-March): 90-120 days. Yield: 3-4 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Requires 60-80 cm rainfall and moderate temperatures.

 ✅ Soil: Grows in loamy or lateritic soil.

 ✅ Usage: Used in Idli batter, dosa, and dal.

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Alappuzha and Kottayam.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (July & Nov): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 15-20 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Feb): 30 kg N, 40 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Mostly rain-fed, one irrigation at pod formation. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew – Sulfur spray (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept & Feb-March): 90-110 days. Yield: 1-2 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 ✅ Climate: Needs warm, humid climate with 50-75 cm rainfall.

 ✅ Soil: Thrives in sandy loam soil with good drainage.

 ✅ Usage: Used in oil extraction, sweets, and Ayurvedic medicine.

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in small farms in Palakkad.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (July-Aug): Broadcasting method (20 cm spacing). Seed rate: 3-5 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 20 kg N, 30 kg P, 20 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Oct): Rain-fed crop, one irrigation at flowering. Pendimethalin (0.75 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Leaf spot – Copper oxychloride (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 80-100 days. Yield: 0.8-1.5 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Rabi (Winter)

 ✅ Climate: Drought-tolerant, needs 50-80 cm rainfall.

 ✅ Soil: Grows well in lateritic soil.

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, soups, and Ayurvedic medicine.

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Common in hilly areas like Wayanad.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM.

 2️⃣ Sowing (Nov-Dec): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 15-20 kg/ha.

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 30 kg N, 40 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Dec-Mar): Mostly rain-fed, one irrigation at flowering. Pendimethalin (0.75 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Rust – Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Feb-March): 100-120 days. Yield: 0.8-1.5 tons/ha.

✅ Season: Year-round

 ✅ Climate: Hot & humid, rainfall 150-300 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained loamy soil, rich in organic matter

 ✅ Usage: Fresh fruit, banana chips, fiber production

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Wayanad, Palakkad, Thiruvananthapuram

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Jan-Feb): 20-25 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (March-April): 1.5x1.5m spacing, suckers transplanted

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (April-Dec): 300g N, 200g P, 400g K/tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (April-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with banana leaves

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Banana weevil – Neem oil spray (5ml/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (10-12 months after planting): Yield 30-35 tons/ha

✅ Season: Summer (March-June)

 ✅ Climate: Humid tropical, rainfall 200-300 cm

 ✅ Soil: Lateritic, well-drained soil

 ✅ Usage: Fresh fruit, chips, sweets

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Found in Thrissur, Kottayam, Kollam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (March-April): 15-20 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (May-June): 8x8m spacing, saplings transplanted

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (June-Nov): 500g N, 300g P, 400g K/tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with organic matter

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit borer – Neem oil spray (5ml/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (March-June): 4-5 years after planting, yield 20-25 tons/ha
Coconut (Chandrakalpa, West Coast Tall, Kerala Tall)
🥥 Coconut \n (Chandrakalpa, West Coast Tall, Kerala Tall)

✅ Season: Year-round

 ✅ Climate: Hot & humid, rainfall 200-400 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam with good moisture retention

 ✅ Usage: Oil extraction, fresh consumption, coir industry

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Alappuzha, Thrissur, Malappuram

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (April-May): 10-12 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (June-July): 7.5x7.5m spacing, seedlings planted

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 500g N, 250g P, 500g K/tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with coconut husk

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Rhinoceros beetle – Neem cake application

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Year-round): 5-6 years after planting, yield 80-100 nuts/tree

✅ Season: Rainy & Winter (July-December)

 ✅ Climate: Humid tropical, rainfall 200-300 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam with acidic pH

 ✅ Usage: Fresh fruit, juices, processed products

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Grown in Ernakulam, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (March-April): 10-15 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (May-June): 30x60 cm spacing, suckers planted

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (June-Dec): 200g N, 150g P, 250g K/tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Feb): Drip irrigation, weeding every 45 days

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Mealybugs – Insecticide spray (Chlorpyrifos 2ml/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (July-Dec): 2 years after planting, yield 30-35 tons/ha

✅ Season: Summer (March-July)

 ✅ Climate: Humid tropical, rainfall 150-250 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained loamy soil

 ✅ Usage: Fresh consumption, juices, pickles

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Palakkad, Wayanad, Thrissur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (June-July): 15-20 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (July-August): 8x8m spacing, grafted saplings used

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Aug-Feb): 500g N, 250g P, 500g K/tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, mulching with dry leaves

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Mango hoppers – Neem-based insecticide spray

 6️⃣ Harvesting (March-July): 3-5 years after planting, yield 12-15 tons/ha
Papaya (Coorg Honeydew, Red Lady, Solo Sunrise)
🍈 Papaya \n (Coorg Honeydew, Red Lady, Solo Sunrise)

✅ Season: Year-round

 ✅ Climate: Warm humid climate, rainfall 150-200 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, high organic matter

 ✅ Usage: Fresh fruit, juices, medicinal uses

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Found in Idukki, Kannur, Kollam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Jan-Feb): 15-20 tons/ha FYM applied

 2️⃣ Planting (March-April): 1.5x2m spacing, seedlings transplanted

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (April-Dec): 300g N, 200g P, 400g K/tree

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (April-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with organic matter

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Papaya ring spot virus – Neem oil spray (5ml/L)

 6️⃣ Harvesting (6-9 months after planting): Yield 25-30 tons/ha
Elephant Foot Yam (Gajendra, Sree Padma, Sree Athira)
🐘 Elephant Foot Yam (Gajendra, Sree Padma, Sree Athira)

✅ Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 ✅ Climate: Warm & humid (25-35°C), high rainfall 150-200 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained red loam with high organic matter

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, pickles, and chips

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Palakkad, Idukki, Thiruvananthapuram

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-June): Deep plowing, FYM 30 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Planting (June-July): Setts (tubers) planted at 75x75 cm spacing

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 90 kg N, 60 kg P, 90 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Nov): Mulching done, light irrigation in dry spells

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Aphids – Neem oil spray, Bordeaux mixture for rot control

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Dec-Feb): 200-250 days after planting, yield 30-40 tons/ha

✅ Season: Summer & Monsoon

 ✅ Climate: Warm & humid (25-30°C), moderate rainfall 100-150 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.5-7.5

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, sambar, and stir-fries

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Thrissur, Kottayam, Ernakulam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Feb-May): Plowed and ridges made, FYM 10-15 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Sowing (March-June): Seeds directly sown, 2-3 seeds per hill

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (April-Aug): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Sept): Light irrigation every 4-5 days

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew – Sulfur dusting, Neem spray for pests

 6️⃣ Harvesting (June-Nov): 50-60 days after sowing, yield 10-12 tons/ha
Bitter Gourd (Preethi, Priya, Arka Harit, Pusa Vishesh)
🌿 Bitter Gourd \n (Preethi, Priya, Arka Harit, Pusa Vishesh)

✅ Season: Kharif & Summer

 ✅ Climate: Warm & humid (25-35°C), high rainfall 150-200 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, pickles, and medicinal preparations

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Malappuram, Kozhikode, Kannur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Feb-April): Plowed and raised beds prepared, FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Sowing (March-May): Seeds sown at 75 cm spacing

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (April-Aug): 90 kg N, 60 kg P, 70 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Sept): Light irrigation every 5-7 days

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit fly – Pheromone traps, neem spray

 6️⃣ Harvesting (June-Oct): 55-65 days after sowing, yield 12-15 tons/ha
Ash Gourd (Sree Padma, KAU Local, Co-2)
🎃 Ash Gourd \n (Sree Padma, KAU Local, Co-2)

✅ Season: Kharif & Summer

 ✅ Climate: Warm & humid (25-30°C), moderate rainfall 100-150 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, sweets (petha), and sambar

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Alappuzha, Kollam, Pathanamthitta

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Feb-May): Plowed & ridges made, FYM 10-15 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Sowing (March-June): Seeds directly sown, 2-3 seeds per hill

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (April-Aug): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Sept): Light irrigation every 4-5 days

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew – Sulfur dusting, Neem spray for pests

 6️⃣ Harvesting (June-Nov): 50-60 days after sowing, yield 10-12 tons/ha

✅ Season: Monsoon & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Warm & humid (25-30°C), high rainfall 150-200 cm

 ✅ Soil: Clayey loam with good drainage

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, stir-fries, and snacks

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Kottayam, Ernakulam, Kasaragod

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (May-July): Deep plowing, FYM 25-30 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Planting (July-August): Corms planted at 60x40 cm spacing

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (Aug-Oct): 90 kg N, 60 kg P, 90 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (Sept-Dec): Irrigation every 10-12 days, mulching done

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Taro leaf blight – Bordeaux mixture spray

 6️⃣ Harvesting (Dec-March): 180-200 days after planting, yield 15-18 tons/ha
Yardlong Bean (Paiyur-1, Arka Mangala, Vellayani Jyothika)
🌿 Yardlong Bean (Paiyur-1, Arka Mangala, Vellayani Jyothika)

✅ Season: Kharif & Rabi

 ✅ Climate: Warm & humid (25-30°C), moderate rainfall 100-150 cm

 ✅ Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 ✅ Usage: Used in curries, stir-fries, and salads

 ✅ Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Thrissur, Palakkad, Wayanad

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1️⃣ Land Preparation (Feb-May): Plowed and ridges made, FYM 10-15 tons/ha applied

 2️⃣ Sowing (March-June): Seeds directly sown, 2-3 seeds per hill

 3️⃣ Nutrient Management (April-Aug): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4️⃣ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Sept): Light irrigation every 4-5 days

 5️⃣ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew – Sulfur dusting, Neem spray for pests

 6️⃣ Harvesting (June-Nov): 50-60 days after sowing, yield 10-12 tons/ha
🌱 1. Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH)

📝 Description:
A centrally sponsored scheme focused on holistic growth of the horticulture sector, including fruits, vegetables, spices, and floriculture.

✅ Eligibility:
• Farmers, FPOs, SHGs, NGOs, cooperatives.
• Must own or lease land for horticulture.

📌 Scheme Criteria:
Financial assistance for:
• Production of planting materials.
• Protected cultivation (greenhouses).
• Post-harvest infrastructure & marketing.
Subsidy: 40%–60% depending on the activity.

⏳ Application Duration:
Typically opens at the beginning of the financial year (April–June).

🖥️ How to Apply:
• Online through AIMS Kerala Portal.
• Or via local Krishi Bhavans.
📝 Description:\nRun by the Coconut Development Board, this scheme boosts coconut productivity through farm-level interventions.

✅ Eligibility:

• Individual coconut farmers, groups, or societies.
• Must have coconut gardens or farms with potential for improvement.

📌 Scheme Criteria:

Financial aid for:

• Replanting, integrated farming.
• Setting up nurseries and processing units.
• Subsidies for seedlings, fertilizers, pest control.
⏳ Application Duration:\n\nApplications typically open from April to August each year.

🖥️ How to Apply:

• Apply through Coconut Board Website.
• Or via the AIMS portal or Krishi Bhavan.
📝 Description:\nThis scheme enhances the sustainability and productivity of rice cultivation by supporting group farming and input assistance.

✅ Eligibility:

• Individual rice farmers and registered group farms.
• Padasekhara Samithies (paddy collectives).

📌 Scheme Criteria:

• ₹5,500 per hectare for seeds and other inputs.
• Encouragement for specialty rice cultivation.
• Focus on sustainable practices and group farming.

⏳ Application Duration:

Application periods align with the rice growing seasons (May–June, October–November).

Check updates annually via AIMS.

🖥️ How to Apply:

• Register or log in to AIMS Kerala Portal.
• Or contact the local Krishi Bhavan.
📝 Description:\nThese programs support infrastructure development, organic farming, and mechanization across Kerala’s agricultural sector.

✅ Eligibility:

• All registered farmers.
• Specific sub-programs may have additional conditions (e.g., landholding, region).

📌 Scheme Criteria:

Support includes:

• Farm mechanization.
• Irrigation systems.
• Training and market access.
• Focus on organic practices and sustainability.

⏳ Application Duration:

Varies depending on sub-program.
Generally active throughout the year in different phases.

🖥️ How to Apply:

• Online via AIMS Portal.
• Or through Krishi Bhavan offices.
